description: Banks facing regulatory sanctions for financial misconduct tend to adopt riskier business practices, according to new research.
title: Stricter oversight needed as financial misconduct drives risk-taking in banking, says study

description: Lately, there have been many headlines about scientific fraud and journal article retractions. If this trend continues, it represents a serious threat to public trust in science.
title: Reliable science takes time. But the current system rewards speed

description: The European Space Agency (ESA) has powered down its Gaia spacecraft after more than a decade spent gathering data that are now being used to unravel the secrets of our home galaxy.
title: Farewell, Gaia! Spacecraft operations come to an end

description: For nearly 15 years, almost no information was available on the population status of Uganda's large carnivores, including those in its largest national park, Murchison Falls. These species represent a critical part of Uganda's growing tourism economy. The country is home to the famed tree-climbing lions, which are much sought after for this unique behavior. Together, lions and leopards generate tens of thousands of dollars annually from safari viewing and allied activities.
title: Uganda's lions in decline, hyenas thriving: New findings from country's biggest ever carnivore count

description: Every time the temperature drops, a cloud passes overhead, or the sun sets, a plant makes a choice: Keep its microscopic pores, called stomata, open to absorb carbon dioxide and continue photosynthesizing or close them to protect its precious stores of water. That capacity to open and close pores requires the plant to respond to subtle environmental changes by adjusting the pressure within the cells of the stomata—a complex ability that plants evolved over hundreds of millions of years.
title: Plant stomata pressure dynamics illuminated by laser-based method offer water efficiency insights

description: Foie gras—the fattened liver of ducks or geese—is a French delicacy prized for its rich, buttery flavor. But its production, which involves force-feeding the animals, has led to bans in several countries.
title: Faux gras? Scientists craft 'more ethical' version of French delicacy

description: Quantum critical points are thresholds that mark the transition of materials between different electronic phases at absolute zero temperatures, around which they often exhibit exotic physical properties.
title: Study proposes new mechanism underpinning intrinsic strange metal behavior

description: Throughout the course of their lives, humans are known to establish and navigate an intricate web of social relationships, ranging from friendships to family bonds, romances, acquaintances, professional relationships and, today, online interactions. Over the past decades, some behavioral scientists have been trying to better understand how people make sense of these different types of relationships.
title: How humans across cultures and historical periods conceptualize relationships

description: Inside a green orb planted in the German countryside is a high-tech aid to prevent wildfires that have grown more common and destructive with rising global temperatures.
title: AI-powered drones track down fires in German forests

description: The first orbital rocket launched from continental Europe crashed seconds after blast-off Sunday, dealing a blow to the continent's bid to build a new space economy.
title: Rocket carrying European orbital vehicle crashes after launch

description: Dozens of tiny black weevils cling onto a fern plant as it is tossed onto a leafy green mat coating the surface of South Africa's Crocodile River.
title: Scientists hope hungry weevils from Louisiana can tackle South Africa's invasive water plants
